content:
Just a heads up to everyone. rustfmt is now in-tree. This means that when you git update, you may need to delete src/tools/rustfmt first, since git doesn't handle removal of submodules well.

Also, errors with building rustfmt should now be blockers similar to clippy. If you have any issues, please ping @Caleb Cartwright or myself.
I love this -- it means you no longer need to pick between a recent nightly and having rustfmt available
Yea, I plan to remove it from toolstate. I wanted to wait to make sure everything settles down and there weren't any issues.
awesome! :tada::tada:
